body:
To cooperate trustworthy in building an open science world is the vision and mission of the iDAI.world. It is the result of a long common development by many partners. Its origin lies in the initiatives of the Research Archive for Ancient Sculpture in Cologne. From this tradition, two key partners of the DAI in the stricter sense of informatics, programming and infrastructure are the Cologne Universitiesâ€™ chair for Archaeoinformatics and the Regional Computing Center in Cologne (RRZK). They were joined by many others over time, namely the Chair for Computer Graphics at the University of Applied Sciences in Dresden, and the Archaeocopter and Archaeonautic project at Dresden University and the Free University in Berlin. Numerous national and international cooperations are shaping the iDAI.world as a service for the community

Without their partners, friends and users, the offer of the iDAI.world would never have arisen in the present form.

title: Cooperation in national and international infrastructures

tiles.headline: ARIADNE
tiles.subhead: The way forward to digital archaeology in Europe

tiles.headline: Archaeocopter and Archaeonautic
tiles.subhead: Recording archaeology with low cost unmanned aerial vehicles
